title: World Cup champion France edges out England to reach semifinals as Harry Kane misses penalty
France leads England 2-1 in a tense match between powerhouse rivals
England's Harry Kane missed a late penalty kick, and France takes the last spot in the semifinals, where it will face Morocco
description: World Cup holder France remains on course in its title defense after beating England 2-1 to reach the semifinals at Qatar 2022.

title: White flowers placed at Grant Wahl's press seat
Cristiano Ronaldo leaves World Cup in tears as chances to win title are shattered by Morocco
description: Cristiano Ronaldo left the 2022 World Cup in tears as his chances to win the tournament for the first time in his career were shattered after his Portugal team was shocked 1-0 by Morocco in the quarterfinals on Saturday.

title: Moroccan ecstasy at World Cup win shared by Africa and Arab world
description: Moroccan fans exploded in joy on Saturday as their team became the first from any African country to reach a World Cup semi-final, filling the stadium with a deafening roar and unleashing cheering, crying, dancing and singing on the streets back home.

title: Freed Russian arms dealer says he 'wholeheartedly' supports Ukraine war and would volunteer if he could
description: Freed Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout said on Saturday he "wholeheartedly" supports Moscow's so-called "military operation" in Ukraine and that if he had the opportunity and necessary skills, he would "certainly go as a volunteer."

title: How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter
description: Arizona Sen. Kyrsten Sinema decided to shake up the political world on Friday by becoming an independent. The former Democrat is still caucusing with the party in the Senate, so the Democratic caucus still has 51 members. Now, instead of 49 Democrats and two independents within their ranks, the caucus has 48 Democrats and three independents.

title: Morocco becomes first ever African team to reach World Cup semifinals
description: Morocco made history Saturday as the first African team to reach a World Cup semifinal, defeating Portugal 1-0 to continue its sparkling run in Qatar.

title: A lost ecosystem revealed in Greenland by oldest environmental DNA
description: The past is an ever-changing story, and this week, myriad discoveries added new details.

title: Russian Nobel Peace laureate slams Putin's 'insane and criminal war' on Ukraine
After rebranding in the West, many beauty companies are still offering to 'whiten' skin elsewhere
Mercury in beauty creams believed to have caused vision loss in woman and put her family at risk
The most cringeworthy moments from 'The White Lotus'
description: Acclaimed series "The White Lotus" — which explores the lives of affluent guests in the playground of a sumptuous resort and the problems they run into while interacting with the locals and each other — was created by Mike White, who can be considered a maestro of cringe.

title: Infrastructure and military among priorities amid energy crunch in Ukraine, prime minister says
5 key takeaways from Xi's trip to Saudi Arabia
description: Years of progressing ties between oil-wealthy Saudi Arabia and China, an economic giant in the east, this week culminated in a multiple-day state visit by Chinese President Xi Jinping to Riyadh, where a number of agreements and summits heralded a "new era" of Chinese-Arab partnership.

title: Russian Nobel Peace laureate slams Putin's war in Ukraine
description: Russian Nobel Peace Prize laureate Yan Rachinsky blasted President Vladimir Putin's "insane and criminal" war on Ukraine in his acceptance speech in the Norwegian capital Oslo on Saturday.

title: Hear LeBron James react to death of sports writer Grant Wahl
description: NBA star LeBron James remarks on the death of prominent American journalist Grant Wahl, who died in Qatar after collapsing while covering the World Cup. CNN's Amanda Davies has more.

title: Portugal vs Morocco and more from the 2022 World Cup
Germany goalkeeper Manuel Neuer breaks leg in skiing accident a week after Germany was knocked out of Qatar 2022
description: Germany goalkeeper and captain Manuel Neuer will miss the rest of the season after breaking his leg in a skiing accident, just over a week after his side crashed out of Qatar 2022.

title: Will 'Emancipation' set Will Smith free from 'the slap?'
description: Are you working on your New Year's resolutions yet?

title: Ukraine PM: Infrastructure and military among priorities amid energy crunch
What goes up... is starting to come down
description: It's too soon to declare victory over inflation, but from gas to chicken to big-screen TVs, there are, increasingly, signs that inflation's grip on American pocketbooks may be loosening.

title: Ronaldo is on the bench for a second consecutive World Cup match
description: • Neymar unsure if he will play again with Brazil

title: Postal worker shot to death while delivering mail in Milwaukee
description: A mail carrier was shot to death Friday evening in Milwaukee, police said.

title: One dead, dozen missing after explosion at apartment block on Channel island of Jersey
description: One person died Saturday and several are missing after an explosion and fire at an apartment building on the British self-governing island of Jersey.

title: Ski resorts are melting. Here's what that means for winter vacations
description: How do you turn a ski resort "green?" The easy answer is to wait until summer.

title: 'It's a Wonderful Life' still draws fans to movie theaters -- decades after its release
description: The one-time lost Christmas classic "It's A Wonderful Life" staged an unlikely comeback in the 1970s and 1980s by becoming a December TV staple, after underperforming at the box office and failing to win big at the Oscars when it debuted in the '40s.

title: LeBron James and Billie Jean King lead tributes to American journalist Grant Wahl
description: The death of prominent journalist Grant Wahl at the World Cup in Qatar has led to an outpouring of shock and grief across the sports world, with NBA star LeBron James and tennis great Billie Jean King leading the tributes to the American.

title: Julius' Bar, the site of an essential 1960s LGBT protest, is officially a historic landmark
description: Julius' Bar, one of New York City's oldest LGBT bars and the location of a crucial 1960s protest, has been officially recognized as a city landmark.

title: Strong midterm turnout in Georgia sparks new debate about a controversial election law
description: The strong turnout in Georgia's runoff election that cemented Democrats' control of the US Senate is sparking fresh debate about the impact of the state's controversial 2021 election law and could trigger a new round of election rule changes next year in the Republican-led state legislature.

title: A portrait of America's prison arts programs
description: In photographer Peter Merts' images of California's Arts in Corrections program, a smiling man is pictured with an acrylic portrait of Pope Francis. It is a fitting choice of subject in a photo series that explores rehabilitation and redemption in America's prison system.

title: King Charles visits Wrexham AFC, the soccer club owned by Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney
description: Talk about Hollywood royalty.

title: After release from Russian custody, focus is providing Griner and family additional support: officials
description: After being imprisoned in Russia for nearly 10 months, WNBA star Brittney Griner's safe return to the US on Friday was marked by a stop at a Texas military medical facility for a routine evaluation, the US State Department said.

title: Neymar says he is unsure if he will play again with Brazil
description: Brazil's Neymar said on Friday he was unsure if he would play again for the national team after their heartbreaking World Cup quarterfinal defeat to Croatia on penalties.

title: Happy returns: When a trip to the airport changes your life
description: In travel news: A court ruling on the seat recline question, the last Boeing 747 rolls off the assembly line and the TSA finds a live dog and an array of weaponry in passengers' luggage.

title: Abalone and Dugongs threatened with extinction, warns IUCN Red List
description: The effects of human activity from climate change to pollution are "devastating" marine life, with nearly a tenth of underwater plants and animals assessed so far threatened with extinction, the latest Red List of Threatened Species showed on Friday.

title: Swear words in different languages have one thing in common
description: What's in a swear? The world's filthiest words typically refer to something vulgar or taboo, for one.

title: Hong Kong pro-democracy media tycoon Jimmy Lai sentenced to 69 months in prison for fraud
description: A Hong Kong court on Saturday sentenced jailed media mogul Jimmy Lai to five years and nine months in prison for fraud, in the latest legal challenge against the pro-democracy tycoon.

title: How a Twitter account with a cat avatar took on Beijing
description: The unprecedented protests that swept China late last month, posing the biggest challenge to leader Xi Jinping's authority since he came to power, had a peculiar focal point: a Chinese Twitter account with a cat avatar.

title: Ukraine keeps patching up its power grid. But Russia's barrage could force more Ukrainians to flee
description: What Russia cannot win on the battlefield, it is seeking to win by casting Ukrainian cities into the dark and cold as a long winter sets in.

title: American journalist Grant Wahl dies at Qatar World Cup
description: American journalist Grant Wahl has died in Qatar while covering the World Cup, US Soccer said in a statement.

title: Video: American soccer journalist Grant Wahl remembered
description: CNN sports analyst Christine Brennan remembers her friend and colleague Grant Wahl, the respected soccer journalist who unexpectedly died in Qatar while covering the World Cup.

title: European Parliament vice president expelled by party amid corruption probe involving Gulf nation
description: Eva Kaili, one of the European Parliament's vice presidents, has been expelled by her political party in Greece amid a corruption probe.

title: World Cup quarterfinals: Morocco on the verge of history against Portugal as Kylian Mbappé's France face England
description: Morocco already caused the upset of the round of 16 when it beat Spain on penalties to make it to the quarterfinals for the first time in its history, but the North Africans will have to replicate their heroics if they want to get past a reinvigorated Portugal.

title: Taiwan fears losing its 'silicon shield' as world courts TSMC
First Gen Z congressman-elect says he was denied apartment over bad credit
description: The congressman-elect set to become the first member of Generation Z to serve in Congress said Thursday his rental application for an apartment in Washington, DC, was denied because of his "really bad" credit.

title: Kylian Mbappé is reaching speeds of 22 miles per hour. Can anyone stop him?
description: Ahead of its World Cup quarterfinal against France, England has a problem to solve. Namely, how to stop the tournament's top scorer, Kylian Mbappé, from adding to his tally.
